intro: Eryngium leavenworthii, commonly known as the prairie eryngo, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, blue-green foliage and purple to pink flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and tubular disc florets, typical of the daisy family. Eryngium leavenworthii is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
